tachyon.client.file

Interface FileSystem

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseFileSystem, LineageFileSystem

    @PublicApi
public interface FileSystem
    Basic file system interface supporting metadata operations and data operations. Developers should not implement this class but extend the default implementation provided by BaseFileSystem instead. This ensures any new methods added to the interface will be provided by the default implementation.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  FileSystem.Factory

      • createDirectory

        void createDirectory(TachyonURI path)
              throws FileAlreadyExistsException,
                     InvalidPathException,
                     IOException,
                     TachyonException
        Convenience method for createDirectory(TachyonURI, CreateDirectoryOptions) with default options.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the directory to create in Tachyon space
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        FileAlreadyExistsException - if there is already a file or directory at the given path
        InvalidPathException - if the path is invalid
        TachyonException - if an unexpected exception is thrown

        FileAlreadyExistsException - if there is already a file or directory at the given path
        InvalidPathException - if the path is invalid
        TachyonException - if an unexpected Tachyon exception is thrown

      • free

        void free(TachyonURI path,
          FreeOptions options)
   throws FileDoesNotExistException,
          IOException,
          TachyonException
        Evicts any data under the given path from Tachyon space, but does not delete the data from the UFS. The metadata will still be present in Tachyon space after this operation.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to free in Tachyon space
        options - options to associate with this operation
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        FileDoesNotExistException - if the given path does not exist
        TachyonException - if an unexpected Tachyon exception is thrown

        List<URIStatus> listStatus(TachyonURI path)
                    throws FileDoesNotExistException,
                           IOException,
                           TachyonException
        Convenience method for listStatus(TachyonURI, ListStatusOptions) with default options.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to list information about
        Returns:
        a list of URIStatuss containing information about the files and directories which are children of the given path
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        FileDoesNotExistException - if the given path does not exist
        TachyonException - if an unexpected Tachyon exception is thrown

      • listStatus

        List<URIStatus> listStatus(TachyonURI path,
                           ListStatusOptions options)
                    throws FileDoesNotExistException,
                           IOException,
                           TachyonException
        If the path is a directory, returns the URIStatus of all the direct entries in it. Otherwise returns a list with a single URIStatus element for the file.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to list information about
        options - options to associate with this operation
        Returns:
        a list of URIStatuss containing information about the files and directories which are children of the given path
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        FileDoesNotExistException - if the given path does not exist
        TachyonException - if an unexpected Tachyon exception is thrown

                  LoadMetadataOptions options)

                  IOException,
                  TachyonException

        options - options to associate with this operation
        Throws:

        TachyonException - if an unexpected Tachyon exception is thrown

      • mount

        void mount(TachyonURI tachyonPath,
           TachyonURI ufsPath)
    throws IOException,
           TachyonException
        Convenience method for mount(TachyonURI, TachyonURI, MountOptions) with default options.
        Parameters:
        tachyonPath - a Tachyon path to mount the data to
        ufsPath - a UFS path to mount the data from
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        TachyonException - if a Tachyon exception occurs

      • mount

        void mount(TachyonURI tachyonPath,
           TachyonURI ufsPath,
           MountOptions options)
    throws IOException,
           TachyonException
        Mounts a UFS subtree to the given Tachyon path. The Tachyon path is expected not to exist as the method creates it. If the path already exists, a TachyonException will be thrown. This method does not transfer any data or metadata from the UFS. It simply establishes the connection between the given Tachyon path and UFS path.
        Parameters:
        tachyonPath - a Tachyon path to mount the data to
        ufsPath - a UFS path to mount the data from
        options - options to associate with this operation
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        TachyonException - if a Tachyon exception occurs

               throws FileDoesNotExistException,

                      TachyonException

      • rename

        void rename(TachyonURI src,
            TachyonURI dst)
     throws FileDoesNotExistException,
            IOException,
            TachyonException
        Convenience method for rename(TachyonURI, TachyonURI, RenameOptions) with default options.
        Parameters:
        src - the path of the source, this must already exist
        dst - the path of the destination, this path should not exist
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        FileDoesNotExistException - if the given file does not exist
        TachyonException - if an unexpected Tachyon exception is thrown

      • rename

        void rename(TachyonURI src,
            TachyonURI dst,
            RenameOptions options)
     throws FileDoesNotExistException,
            IOException,
            TachyonException
        Renames an existing Tachyon path to another Tachyon path in Tachyon. This operation will be propagated in the underlying storage if the path is persisted.
        Parameters:
        src - the path of the source, this must already exist
        dst - the path of the destination, this path should not exist
        options - options to associate with this operation
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        FileDoesNotExistException - if the given file does not exist
        TachyonException - if an unexpected Tachyon exception is thrown

        void setAcl(TachyonURI path,
            SetAclOptions options)
     throws TachyonException,
            IOException
        Sets the acl of a file or directory.
        Parameters:
        path - to be set acl on
        options - the acl option to be set
        Throws:
        TachyonException - if a Tachyon error occurs
        IOException - an I/O error occurs

      • unmount

        void unmount(TachyonURI path)
      throws IOException,
             TachyonException
        Convenience method for unmount(TachyonURI, UnmountOptions) with default options.
        Parameters:
        path - a Tachyon path, this must be a mount point
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        TachyonException - if a Tachyon exception occurs

      • unmount

        void unmount(TachyonURI path,
             UnmountOptions options)
      throws IOException,
             TachyonException
        Unmounts a UFS subtree identified by the given Tachyon path. The Tachyon path match a previously mounted path. The contents of the subtree rooted at this path are removed from Tachyon but the corresponding UFS subtree is left untouched.
        Parameters:
        path - a Tachyon path, this must be a mount point
        options - options to associate with this operation
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon exception occurs
        TachyonException - if a Tachyon exception occurs
